intro: Pleioceras gilletii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant produces a milky sap that contains latex, which is toxic to some animals. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. The flowers emit a strong fragrance to attract nocturnal pollinators such as moths.
